creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: chaotic fight scene between centaurs and nude women; figures are fighting with arrows, ceramics, shields, daggers, etc.
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, Stamp

-- inscribed in plate at bottom edge: [CVM .PRIVILEGIO .REGIS.]
-- in graphite on verso: I3M 292 | RD. 288 | 1est | avant NO
markings: black stamp on verso, bottom center: P. von Baldinger-Seidenberg, Lugt 212; unidentified blue stamp(s), LL, not in Lugt
portfolio: From From Combats and Triumphs, Plate 8
provenance: P. von Baldinger-Seidenberg (died 1911), Lugt 212, Stuttgart (until 1912; sale H. G. Gutekunst, Stuttgart, May 1912). Collector with unidentified mark (not in Lugt). John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Combat of Centaurs and Lapiths, and Hippodamia Abducted by a Centaur, From Combats and Triumphs
